means: （尤指军队的）副司令员，副指挥员，第二把手

sentence.Network_en: He was posted to Hong Kong as second-in-command of C Squadron.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被派遣到香港任C中队的副队长。

sentence.Network_en: The President was replaced by his second-in-command.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统一职由其副手接替。

sentence.Network_en: Mordecai, a Jew in exile, refused to bow to Haman , second in command to King Ahasuerus.
sentence.Network_cn: 末底改是一个被掳的犹太人, 拒绝向亚哈随鲁王的第一宠臣哈曼跪拜.

entry.def: A second-in-command is someone who is next in rank to the leader of a group, and who has authority to give orders when the leader is not there.

example.ex: He was posted to Hong Kong as second-in-command of C Squadron...
example.tran: 他被派遣到香港任C中队的副队长。

example.ex: The President was replaced by his second-in-command.
example.tran: 总统一职由其副手接替。
